Key Match Events: Miami owned a 14-point second-half lead with 6:38 left in the third quarter.
Nikola Jovic recorded 20 points, six rebounds, four assists, and one steal.
Bam Adebayo had 19 points and nine rebounds.
Miami finished with a minus-four on the glass but had 32 assists on 43 made baskets.
Jaime Jaquez added 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting.
Duncan Robinson had 12 points on 4-of-5 from deep.
Miami snapped their three-game losing streak.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat entered the game off a double-overtime loss to the Sacramento Kings after blowing a 17-point fourth-quarter lead.
Miami didn't let the lead dip below seven points the rest of the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Miamiâ€™s win on Tuesday snaps their three-game losing streak, moving them to 18-17.
The team will now try to enact revenge on the Utah Jazz, who beat them by 36 last week inside Kaseya Center, on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second night of a back-to-back for the Heat.
Miami shot 55.0 percent (11-20) and 5-of-11 from 3-point range in the period.
